FAQ

  • How do I fix overlapping item elements?
  • What is Packery’s browser support?
  • What is the difference between Isotope, Masonry, and Packery?
  • How do I get the order of item elements after dragging?
  • There’s a gap that goes away after resizing

How do I fix overlapping item elements?

You need to initialize or trigger `.layout()` after all the items have their proper size. If your elements have images, use imagesLoaded. See also Appendix - Web fonts.

What is Packery’s browser support?

Packery works in IE8+ and modern browsers, including mobile browsers on iOS and Android.

What is the difference between Isotope, Masonry, and Packery?

Isotope, Masonry, and Packery are all similar in that they are layout libraries. Many of their options and methods are the same.

Masonry does cascading grid “masonry” layouts. Packery does bin-packing layouts, which allow it to be used for draggable interactions.

Isotope does sorting and filtering. Isotope uses masonry and packery layouts, as well as other layouts.

Masonry is licensed MIT and is freely available for use and distribution. Isotope and Packery have a proprietary license, where you can purchase a license for commercial projects, or use it freely for open-source projects.

How do I get the order of item elements after dragging?

Use getItemElements.

// show item order after layout
function orderItems() {
  var itemElems = $container.packery('getItemElements');
  $( itemElems ).each( function( i, itemElem ) {
    $(itemElem).text( i + 1 );
  });
}

$container.packery( 'on', 'layoutComplete', orderItems );
$container.packery( 'on', 'dragItemPositioned', orderItems );

Edit this example or vanilla JS example on CodePen

There’s a gap that goes away after resizing

This gap may be caused by the vertical scroll-bar. Try making the scroll-bar persistent with this CSS.

html { overflow-y: scroll; }
